Class StickPuppet

  • Object
    • StickPuppet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StickFigure

    class StickPuppet
extends Object
    StickPuppet is the base-class for StickFigure, and could also be the base-class for anything non-humanoid you wanted to model in the same way (e.g. a dog, an octopus, a dragon...)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int currentDrag
      The unique index of the vertex currently being mouse-dragged, or -1 if none of the vertices in this StickPuppet are currently being dragged.
      PVector pv
      Contains the x-y location within the sketch of where the StickPuppet's root vertex is (the StickFigure's root vertex is its PELVIS).
      ArrayList<Vertex> vertices
      Contains all the StickPuppet's vertices.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StickPuppet() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addChild(int nChild, int nParent)
      Creates a parent-child relationship between two vertices, specified by array index.
      void drawPoints()
      Draws a point at each vertex so you can see what can be manipulated with the mouse (such "points" are also sometimes called lugs, handles or pivots).
      boolean mouseDragged()
      To make a StickPuppet mouse controlled, call its mousePressed, mouseReleased and mouseDragged functions from the Processing functions with the same name.
      boolean mousePressed()
      To make a StickPuppet mouse controlled, call its mousePressed, mouseReleased and mouseDragged functions from the Processing functions with the same name.
      boolean mouseReleased()
      To make a StickPuppet mouse controlled, call its mousePressed, mouseReleased and mouseDragged functions from the Processing functions with the same name.
      void tween(float value, float start, float stop, StickPuppet a, StickPuppet b)
      Sets this StickPuppet to a pose somewhere in between the two poses given.

      • Methods inherited from class Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • currentDrag

        int currentDrag
        The unique index of the vertex currently being mouse-dragged, or -1 if none of the vertices in this StickPuppet are currently being dragged.

      • pv

        PVector pv
        Contains the x-y location within the sketch of where the StickPuppet's root vertex is (the StickFigure's root vertex is its PELVIS).

      • vertices

        ArrayList<Vertex> vertices
        Contains all the StickPuppet's vertices. Note that the root vertex should be item zero in the ArrayList.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StickPuppet

        StickPuppet()

    • Method Detail

      • drawPoints

        public void drawPoints()
        Draws a point at each vertex so you can see what can be manipulated with the mouse (such "points" are also sometimes called lugs, handles or pivots).

      • mousePressed

        public boolean mousePressed()
        To make a StickPuppet mouse controlled, call its mousePressed, mouseReleased and mouseDragged functions from the Processing functions with the same name.
        Returns:
        true if the mousePressed event is relevant to the StickPuppet. Otherwise false, and you can offer the event to some other object.

      • mouseReleased

        public boolean mouseReleased()
        To make a StickPuppet mouse controlled, call its mousePressed, mouseReleased and mouseDragged functions from the Processing functions with the same name.
        Returns:
        true if the mouseReleased event is relevant to the StickPuppet. Otherwise false, and you can offer the event to some other object.

      • mouseDragged

        public boolean mouseDragged()
        To make a StickPuppet mouse controlled, call its mousePressed, mouseReleased and mouseDragged functions from the Processing functions with the same name.
        Returns:
        true if the mouseDragged event is relevant to the StickPuppet. Otherwise false, and you can offer the event to some other object.

      • addChild

        public void addChild(int nChild,
                     int nParent)
        Creates a parent-child relationship between two vertices, specified by array index.
        Parameters:
        nChild - The array index of the child vertex in this new relationship
        nParent - The array index of the parent vertex in this new relationship

      • tween

        public void tween(float value,
                  float start,
                  float stop,
                  StickPuppet a,
                  StickPuppet b)
        Sets this StickPuppet to a pose somewhere in between the two poses given. The parameters are based on Processing's map() function - in fact the only difference should be that we are not mapping to floats we are mapping to StickPuppets.
        Parameters:
        value - The incoming value to be converted
        start - The lower bound of the value's current range
        stop - The upper bound of the value's current range
        a - The start pose
        b - The end pose
